moves.3... c5 4. c3 Nc6 5. Nf3 Qb6 6. Bd3:
Black would be mistaken to try and win the d4 pawn.  After 6 ... cxd4 7 cxd4 Nxd4 8 Nxd4 Qxd4?? 9 Bb5 !

This uncovers an attack on black's queen and check's the black king.
moves.7. dxc5 Bxc5 8. O-O f6 9. b4 Be7 10. b5:
Putting the question to the Knight.

Does black retreat the knight to the edge of the board or trade Knights
moves.10... Nxe5 11. Nxe5 fxe5 12. Qh5+ Kd8: g6 is not an option because Bxg6 and black cannot recapture without losing a Rook, so white gains a pawn and board space for free
moves.13. Qxe5 Bf6: 13... Nf6 reduces black's forces to passivity, unfortunately 13...Bf6 trades off black's most active piece.
